questions.question: After performing the experiment, you calculate the GCV as 8500 J/g for a fuel. What does this value practically indicate?

answers.a: The temperature of the water after combustion
answers.b: The total energy released per gram of fuel
answers.c: The oxygen pressure used in the bomb
answers.d: The water equivalent of the calorimeter

questions.question: During the experiment, if the temperature rise was less than expected, what could be a possible cause?
